thread.title: Panthers, islanders downed in weekend pitch play
thread.title_full: Panthers, islanders downed in weekend pitch play

author: news@courierpublicationsllc.com (Staff)
title: Panthers, islanders downed in weekend pitch play
text:
High school boys and girls soccer Panthers, islanders downed in weekend pitch play By Staff | Oct 12, 2015 
It was a good weekend for road teams for Midcoast high school soccer squads — which proved bad news for Medomak Valley and Vinalhaven/North Haven as the teams suffered home defeats. 
The Panther boys dropped a 2-0 decision to Maranacook of Readfield on Saturday, Oct. 10, while both islander squads hosted Richmond, with the boys falling 4-0 and the girls 7-1 in a pair of games on Friday, Oct. 9. 
The following is a recap of reported results: 
Boys soccer 
Maranacook 2, Medomak Valley 0 
At Waldoboro Oct. 10, the Black Bears blanked the host Panthers. Maranacook led 2-0 at halftime. 
Zack Godbout and Jason Brooks scored for Maranacook. 
Maranacook outshot Medomak Valley 11-4. Zach Starr made eight saves in goal for the Panthers, while Justin Freeman made four saves in net for the Black Bears. 
In the Maine Principals' Association Heal Point Standings for Class B North, Medomak Valley (6-3-2, 59.1327 points) is seventh, while Ellsworth (10-0-1, 110.9439 points) is first in the 18-team region. The top 12 teams qualify for the playoffs. 
Richmond 4, Vinalhaven/North Haven 0 
At Vinalhaven Oct. 9, the Bobcats blanked the host islanders. 
Leading the Richmond offense was Brendan Emmons (goal, assist), Cody Tribbett (goal), Matt Rines (goal) and Nick Adams (goal). 
Isles Blackington made five saves in net for the islanders, while Zach Small and Matt Holt combined to make six saves in goal for the Bobcats. 
In the Maine Principals' Association Heal Point Standings for Class D South, Vinalhaven/North Haven (3-6, 31.0931 points) is eighth, while Buckfield (12-1, 102.7187 points) is first in the 14-team region. The top 10 teams qualify for the playoffs. 
Girls soccer 
Richmond 7, Vinalhaven/North Haven 1 
At Vinalhaven Oct. 9, the Bobcats eased past the host islanders by a six-goal margin. 
Leading the Richmond offense was Autumn Acord (2 goals), Kelsea Anair (2 goals), Caitlin Kendrick (goal), Camryn Hurley (goal) and Meranda Martin (3 assists). 
Déja Doughty creased the net for the islanders' lone tally. 
Gilleyanne Davis-Oakes made 13 saves in net for the hosts, while Sydney Tilton made four saves in goal for the visitors. 
In the Maine Principals' Association Heal Point Standings for Class D South, Vinalhaven/North Haven (7-3, 51.5873 points) is third, while Richmond (10-1, 97.2087 points) is first in the 10-team region. The top seven teams qualify for the playoffs.
